programme.title: World’s Greatest Motivators

programme.title: World’s Greatest Motivators
programme.desc: Les Brown, with cameo appearances by Bob Proctor, David Meltzer, Mary Morrissey and special guest, celebrity boxer and motivator, Sugar Ray Leonard

programme.title: Fund Tank
programme.desc: In the premiere episode of Fund Tank, viewers are introduced to Charlie Cimitile, an enterprising entrepreneur with a passion for the burgeoning cannabis industry. With a background in medical device sales, Charlie shares his journey of starting Day 1 Distro, an ancillary cannabis distribution company on the East Coast. Facing financial challenges and a desire for rapid growth, Charlie pitches his business to a panel of investors, laying out his vision for expanding his product offerings and capturing a larger market share.

programme.title: Fund Tank
programme.desc: Guy Mounier, the CEO of Aptivio, seeks a $500,000 investment to expand his AI-driven lead generation business. Aptivio's AI engine, similar to ChatGPT, analyzes online behavior to identify potential clients. However, the investors express concerns about market saturation and the clarity of Aptivio's value proposition.

programme.title: Fund Tank
programme.sub-title: Fund Tank - Evidence Based Classroom Solutions
programme.desc: Chad Honeycutt, owner and CEO of Evidence-Based Classroom Solutions, pitches his business. Chad discusses how his company addresses the deficit in evidence-based services for students with disabilities, particularly autism and emotional disabilities, in public schools. Despite significant revenue growth, Chad seeks investment due to cash flow challenges, primarily caused by delays in insurance reimbursements. The panel expresses concerns about profitability and the need for clearer communication about the company's mission.

programme.title: Fund Tank
programme.desc: Phil Fogarty, owner of PSA Security, discusses his business struggles and funding needs with Joe Camberato, CEO of National Business Capital. Phil's security company faced challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic but pivoted successfully to provide social distance monitoring services, leading to significant revenue growth. Despite increasing demand, cash flow constraints hinder further expansion. Phil emphasizes his motivation to succeed for his family and seeks guidance on refining his pitch and understanding financial metrics.

programme.title: Fund Tank
programme.sub-title: Fund Tank - Kids of Valor Academy
programme.desc: Mona Jackson, owner of Kids of Valor Academy, seeks funding of $600,000 to support her childcare business, which currently operates four locations. Mona shares her inspiring journey, highlighting her commitment to providing affordable childcare in urban areas, driven by her own experiences as a teen mother. She plans to expand her academy to seven locations and aims to create a safe haven for women leaving domestic violence situations. Mona discusses her revenue, profitability, and organizational structure, emphasizing her all-female management team and the positive impact she aims to make in her community.

programme.desc: Are aphrodisiacs really a love potion? And the experts weigh in on the science of sex addiction. All this and more on Sex Talk with Dr. Lia.

programme.title: Sex Talk
programme.sub-title: Sex Talk - Beware of Casual Sex on Vacation
programme.desc: Self-confidence is sexy, but how do you get it? Plus, what happens in Vegas doesn't stay in Vegas. Avoiding sexually transmitted infections after casual sex on vacation. All this and more on Sex Talk with Dr. Lia.

programme.title: Sex Talk
programme.sub-title: Sex Talk - What are the Post-Sex Blues?
programme.desc: Ever have the post-sex blues? You aren’t alone. Plus, why cheating isn’t always about sex. All this and more on Sex Talk with Dr. Lia.

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series
programme.desc: Today's posture is Bakasana, a powerful arm balance that will help you find that energy in the arms, the core and the entire body.

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series
programme.desc: Day 23 is all about love. Start practice by tuning into breath and body, bringing a special attention to the heartspace. Take a moment for feeling into the vibration of the heart, welcoming a feeling of receptivity. Warm yourself up as Kino brings extra attention to opening the chest and front body. Next we segue into finding and loving your particular expression of Gomukhasana, the cow facing posture. Remember that the cow is a sacred symbol of giving and love as you feel into the postures heart opening effects.

programme.title: Good Morning Joy
programme.sub-title: Good Morning Joy - End Burnout Forever with Patrice Bonfiglio
programme.desc: Patrice Bonfiglio, hedge fund president and host of The Burnout Club, is on a mission to show that success and joy can coexist—and burnout can be a thing of the past! Patrice joins Shari for a spicy challenge—expect laughs and surprises!

programme.title: Good Morning Joy
programme.sub-title: Good Morning Joy - The Mind of Love with Marianne Williamson
programme.desc: Marianne Williamson, NY Times bestselling author, spiritual leader, and former presidential candidate, joins to discuss her new book The Mystic Jesus: The Mind of Love. They explore how love can transform the world.

programme.title: The Aware Show
programme.sub-title: The Aware Show - The Art of Anti-Aging
programme.desc: Lisa Garr talks with anti-aging experts Debra Poneman and Ronnie Newman about the importance of lowering stress for health and vitality. They also share simple meditation exercises and healthy recipes.

programme.title: The Aware Show
programme.sub-title: The Aware Show - Numerology with The Numbers Lady!
programme.desc: Lisa Garr talks with expert numerologist Glynis McCants. Known as “The Numbers Lady,” she talks about the history of Numerology as a numbers system and as a science used by Pythagoras forward. She explains about your life path & your personal year.

programme.title: The Aware Show
programme.sub-title: The Aware Show - Healthy Living Beauty!
programme.desc: Lisa Garr talks with Nadine Artemis, founder of natural skin care company Living Libations, about how most “natural” beauty products contain traces of chemicals. Artemis believes that each plant has a certain vibration which can be used in healing.

programme.title: The Aware Show
programme.sub-title: The Aware Show - Hollywood to the Himalayas
programme.desc: Lisa Garr talks with author and spiritual teacher Sadhvi Bhagawati Saraswati about knowing when to trust a deep, inner calling. She was completing her Ph.D. at Stanford when she left America to live in India, where she has been for over 25 years.

programme.title: Good Morning Joy

programme.title: The Inspiration Show
programme.sub-title: Using Mindfulness to Erase Negative Habits With Dawa Tarchin Phillips
programme.desc: Dawa explores whether your mind controls you or you control your mind, as well as, how mindfulness can erase negative thinking and bad habits.

programme.title: Fund Tank
programme.desc: Steve Perez pitches his business, Invisishield, which specializes in automotive accessories for OEMs and dealerships. Facing cash flow challenges exacerbated by multiple merchant cash advances, Perez seeks funding to consolidate debt, purchase materials, and acquire equipment.
